title: 20 cards of strings of beads

  title_text: 20 cards of strings of beads

 Malaysia) Singapore

  styles_periods_indexing_terms: Peranakan

  inscriptions: 

  inscription_language: 

  shape: irregular

  object_colour: multicolored

  physical_appearance: This is a set of 20 cards each containing strings of seed beads. There are four carrying green beads of various shades
 two with blue beads of various shades
 and the rest bearing beads of various colours.

  subject_terms_1: Peranakan sewing tools tailors beadwork (visual works)

  subject_terms_2: Beads Peranakan (Asian people) Sewing Equipment and supplies Tailors Clothing trade Bead embroidery

  subject_terms_3: Vanishing trade Textile art and design

  sgcool_label_text: Strings of seed beads used in nyonya needlework are hung on these 20 cardboard pieces. The presence of shop marks on the backs of some of the cards is also important in identifying the provenance of these materials. Handwritten labels indicating the sizes of strings of beads also useful show how beads were categorised by size. These beads show the variety of bead types available to embroiderers in Malacca and Singapore. The original owner of these items made a living fashioning beaded slippers and dresses
 working from home as she did not have a shop.
